10. This figure of “importation” from France runs throughout Berman’s introductory essay, and this foreign influence is made responsible for all the excesses of PCism. The latter, Berman implies, would have been avoided if the American left liberal tradition had not encountered French “cynicism”: “Political correctness in the 1990s ... is the fog that arises from American liberalism’s encounter with the iceberg of French cynicism” (op. cit., p.24).
